title: Representative Learning Design (RLD)-Based Skill Development Program for Amateur Female Cricket Players

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic cricket rules and fundamental techniques
context.additional_context: Simulated training environment resembling actual competitions using digital devices, emphasizing team collaboration and individual skill analysis

learning_goals: Training environments that simulate game situations can be designed by applying RLD principles
Proficiency metrics for batting and pitching techniques (e.g., accuracy, reaction speed) can be improved by 20% or more
Decision-making and situational awareness skills are evaluated across game scenarios
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
